Text.Value: Like I'm humouring you in this conversation?
True - my instinct is to rush in and try to make everything better, you know?
I'm sure I'll find someone else  to play with - maybe in the city. Until then, all I can do is be here for them.
Their friend is gone - give them time.
Thank you - you always know just what to say.
The kids have been really down - I figured a concert would cheer them up. Or distract them, at least. What do you say?
It'd be like a private concert, just for them - they'd love it!
Sorry, I didn't mean to snub you, I'm just worried about the kids. Mol is still missing, and they haven't taken it too well.
Sorry, now is not a good time - the kids need me.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed at player but trying to hide it

Text.Value: Let's see what you've got.
No thanks.
Hah! Just try and keep up.
Exactly! They've never had time to be kids. And who knows when they'll get a chance again...
Oh, oh! I have an idea - why don't we play together?
Ah! A fellow bard. Sorry to ask out of the blue, but would you like to play together?
Well, brainy-breeches, I did have a better idea - a private concert, just for the kids! Alas, you're no bard.
I've been trying to cheer them up, but I think they're just humouring me...
Are you all right?
But you're right - I should give them some space.

EditorData.NodeContext: a sad sigh, she feels powerless that she can't do more, but is grateful for the player's advice

Text.Value: Well, brainy-breeches, I have a better idea, and I'm so glad you volunteered to help.
You and me, battling it out - bard to bard. What do you say?
Maybe... I'd love to put on a show - just for them. But it's boring if I'm the only one playing.
I just killed an immortal, and that's all you have to say?
Keep trying - they need some fun right now.
I've been trying to cheer them up, we're writing a song together. But I think they're just humouring me...
Writing a song is hardly going to distract them.
I was expecting a little more enthusiasm.
I need another bard - maybe I'll find one in the city. Until then - the kids and I shall work on our masterpiece!
You and me performing, a private concert - just for the kids. They'd love it, I'm sure!
True. You know what would be amazing? A concert - just for the kids. Problem is, it's boring if it's just me playing.
I hope I'll find a bard in the city. The kids would love a little show, I'm sure of it!
You're lucky to be travelling with such a talented musician - I hope I run into you both in the city.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited and a little star struck

Text.Value: Oh, I thought... all right. No problem.
Like I'm humouring you by having this conversation?
Yes! I've missed this. If you can't keep up, don't take it to heart.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited, about to play with a bard for the first time in forever

Text.Value: You know what, you're right. So let's give them a real show, shall we?
Sorry, I'm just worried about the kids. Mol is still missing, and they haven't taken it too well.
I'm sure they appreciate it.
I'll keep an eye on the kids, don't you worry.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried but determined to help the kids

Text.Value: Rude as ever I see. Don't know why I bother.
That was a blast - thank you! I hope we get to play again sometime soon.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited and a little star struck

Text.Value: Sure. Ready when you are.
You're here! Good... that's good.

EditorData.NodeContext: not convincing - she's trying to put on a brave face, but is upset

Text.Value: Me? Oh, I'm fine. I'm just worried about the kids. Mol is still missing, and they haven't taken it too well.

Synopsis: Alfira is leading the kids in a bit of fun moment of constructing their story into a ballad of sorts. When the player arrives they will have just finished up the lyrics and if the player is a bard, Alfira will invite them to play along with. At the end of the duet (gameplay playing animation with music, not a full cinematic) the Bard is given the Shining Dawn ability.
